required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of DA-9801 to Treat Diabetic Neuropathic Pain
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Placebo-controlled, Randomized, Double-blind, Phase II Clinical Trial With Diabetic Neuropathy Patients is Designed to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of the DA-9801 Tablet for Neuropathic Pain and to Decide Optimal Dose.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase II dose-ranging study to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of DA-9801 in the treatment of pain associated with diabetic neuropathy. Subjects will receive either 300mg, 600mg, 900mg or placebo, three times daily for eight weeks. During treatment, pain score by Likert numerical rating scale, Patient Global Impression of Improvement (PGI-I) and Change in Clinical Global Impression(CGI)are accessed to evaluate the effectiveness.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in average 24-h pain intensity (Likert scale) between before and after IP administration
primary_outcome.description: Subject records the average pain intensity for the past 24 hours in the patient diary at the same time every morning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Inter-group difference in average 24-h pain intensity (Likert scale)
secondary_outcome.description: The mean value of the last one week since the date of visit was calculated to compare the difference between treatment groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Most severe mean pain intensity (Likert Scale)
secondary_outcome.description: Subject records the most severe pain intensity for the past 24 hours in the patient diary at the same time every morning.
Subject records the overnight pain intensity during the previous night in the patient diary at the same time every morning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's Global Impression of improvement (1 point ~ 7 point)
secondary_outcome.description: Subject evaluated the level of symptom improvement during the visits after IP administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impression of severity (1 point ~ 7 point)
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator evaluated the level of symptom severity when a subject visited the institution.
Subject records dose of acetaminophen during the past 24 hours in patient diary at the same time every

intervention.description: 300mg of DA-9801 tablet is assigned at week 0 point and is taken for 8 continuous weeks, 3 times a day.
600mg of DA-9801 tablet is assigned at week 0 point and is taken for 8 continuous weeks, 3 times a day.
900mg of DA-9801 tablet is assigned at week 0 point and is taken for 8 continuous weeks, 3 times a day.
Placebo is assigned at week 0 point and is taken for 8 continuous weeks, 3 times a day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- the age of 20 ~ 70
- Type I or Type II Diabetes
- HbA1c â‰¤11%
- Patients with diabetic neuropathic pain for at least 3 months
- Patients corresponding to average pain level of 4 points or more for 24 hours evaluated with 11-point Likert scale
Exclusion Criteria:
- neuropathic pain due to other causes or another stronger pain other than neuropathic pain
- abnormal in blood pressure, weight, ALT/AST, Serum creatinine
- positive reaction in HIV, HBV, or HCV
- experience of suicide try or Mental Illness Medical History
- BDI(Beck Depression Inventory) grade exceeding 21 points chronic alcohol abuse history

overall_official.affiliation: Catholic University Yeouido St. Mary's Hopspital
